title.narrative: 4.3 MICRONUTRIENT, DEWORM & SUP FOOD

description.narrative: Output 4.3: By 2018, children, adolescents, pregnant and lactating women have access to and utilize micronutrient supplementation and fortification services, which contributes to Micronutrients, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 4: Children under 5, pregnant and lactating women, particularly among the most vulnerable, have access to and make greater use of quality promotional, preventive and curative services for the prevention of chronic malnutrition, management of acute malnutrition and reduction of micronutrient deficiencies.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTERE DE LA POSTE ET DES NOUVEL TECHNOLOGIES DE L INFORMATION

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
Maternal nutrition, including information, supplementation and counselling
Salt iodization and other large-scale food fortification
Vitamin A supplementation in early childhood (children under 5)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4.3: By 2018, children, adolescents, pregnant and lactating women have access to and utilize micronutrient supplementationand fortification services

description.narrative: Vitamin A and deworming campaigns were conducted in 2018 however, more sustainable approaches need to be explored. The Government did not allocate any funds for iron/folate procurement, which negatively impact coverage of iron/folate supplementation among pregnant women. In addition, the monitoring system for iodized salt needs to be strengthened. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:30/01/2019

title.narrative: Proportion of children aged 6-24 months benefiting from multi-micronutrient powder supplements at least once during the previous six months in targeted municipalities

Existence of supply to provide two annual doses of vitamin A supplements to all children aged 6-59 months available
% of mothers of children under 6 months of age that benefited from iron folate supplementation for 4 months during their last pregnancy
Existence of strategy of Anemia Reduction
Strategy to ensure the availability, accessibility and use of iodised salt available and implemented
Existence of a functional national coordination body for the control of iodine deficiency disorders
